citation.article-title: A new H2/CO2-using acetogenic bacterium from the rumen: description of Ruminococcus schinkii sp. nov.

p.s: Description of the new species Ruminococcus schinkii sp. nov.
Coccobacillar cells, occurring in pairs or short chains. Average size: 0.8-1.1x1.4-2.8 μm. Gram-positive, non-motile and no flagella. No spore formation.
Starch, gelatin and urea not hydrolyzed.
Oxidase and catalase not produced. nitrate not reduced.
Lithotrophic production of acetate from the gas mixture H2/CO2 (20:80%).
A broad variety of organic substrates are fermented, including aromatic compounds: D-glucose.
D-galactose. maltose, ribose, saccharose, glycerol, syringic acid. gallic acid, and ferulic acid.
Selective enrichment with H2/C02 as energy source.
Source: rumen contents of a 3-day-old lamb.
Type strain: Strain B = DSMZ 10518 deposited in Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen GmbH.
